flawed_nl_solution:
If Rayden bought three times as many ducks as Lily, then he has 3*20 = <<3*20=60>>60 ducks
He has 60-20 = <<60-20=40>>40 more ducks than Lily has.
Rayden also bought 4*10 = <<4*10=40>>40 geese, four times the geese that Lily bought.
He has 40-10= <<40-10=40>>40 more ducks than Lily.
Altogether, Rayden has 40+40 = <<40+40=80>>80 more ducks and geese than Lily.
#### 80

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 30, not 40. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
